node.title: Judge Orders Freeze of Alex Murdaugh's Finances Amid Concerns Jailed Lawyer is Hiding Millions
node.alt: Alex Murdaugh awaits the beginning of his bond hearing in the Richland Judicial Center in Columbia, S.C., Tuesday, Oct. 19, 2021. The former lawyer's finances have been frozen and will be assessed.
node.description: The jailed lawyer's finances are being assessed after a prosecuting attorney suggested he could be hiding millions of dollars.
node.content:
["A South Carolina judge has frozen the finances of a prominent lawyer at the center of multiple investigations.", "The Associated Press is reporting that Judge Daniel Hall has ordered an assessment of Alex Murdaugh's finances. Prosecutors suspect that the jailed Murdaugh is hiding millions of dollars that could be shifted into different accounts. The theory was proposed by attorney Mark Tinsley, representing the family of a young woman killed in a crash involving Murdaugh's boat. Due to Hall's decision, Murdaugh's assets will be reviewed and cataloged to determine if he can get ahold of the money while in jail.", "\"They have refused from day one to give me any information,\" said Tinsley in a statement.", "Attorney John Tiller, representing Murdaugh in the case, argues that his client has yet to be charged in any civil suits and thus cannot have his finances assessed. He also says that the decision to freeze his client's assets could \"open the door for similar [rulings] to happen in countless other cases,\" according to the Associated Press.", "Murdaugh is currently held in the Richland County Jail without bond. He is being charged with stealing nearly $3 million in insurance payments after the falling death of his housekeeper in 2018. He is also being accused of planning his death for his surviving son, Buster, to receive a $10 million life insurance payment.", "For more reporting from the Associated Press, see below.", "", "
Alex Murdaugh awaits the beginning of his bond hearing in the Richland Judicial Center in Columbia, S.C., Tuesday, Oct. 19, 2021. The former lawyer's finances have been frozen and will be assessed.
", "The family's lawsuit says Murdaugh is trying to hide millions of dollars they could possibly collect in their lawsuit and he could shift money between unknown accounts and potentially sell off property and a boat after he turned all his affairs over to Buster.", "The receivers will get part of any legal settlements or judgments against Murdaugh in the cases they are involved.", "Murdaugh's legal team did not immediately respond to a request to comment on Tuesday's ruling.", "The lawyers for the housekeeper's family and a second teen who survived the boat crash have also sued Murdaugh and helped with getting the receivers. Those attorneys expect judges in their cases to allow them to use the independent monitors.", "The same day that Murdaugh was arrested, the father signed a power of attorney for all his affairs over to his son, according to court records."]
